column4: So apparently I lost my Windows XP install CD while moving to a new house.  Am I screwed for setting up any sort of virtual machine now?
castoff - yeah, but it's installed on the actual hardware, as a dual-boot
if u owned a copy of windows before there is the OEM version of windows xp on demonoid.com u can dl it and burn it it will be all legit and wga authenticated
- thanks, I'll try to look that up.
hold on
http://www.demonoid.com/files/details/331860/1141263/
- thanks.  any comments onto the legality of this method?
http://www.demonoid.com/files/details/320911/1141263/
first one is home second one is pro
i think its legit if u had a copy before
great...now normally to use a virtual drive I'd use daemon or alcohol on windows.  But I'm not sure how to do it on a Linux
sudo mount file.iso /media/iso/ -t iso9660 -o loop
- which of those do I replace with the filename/pasth of the image I'm trying to mouht?
hey
file.iso u have to cd into the file iso directory and mount
or just provide the full path
u running widnows on vmware?
Demonoid won't let me download w/out registering.
- Demonoid is restricting downloads to registered users, and unfortunately open registrations are closed
damn it
try piratebay and isohunt then
imbecile - well, that's another week away =/  I'll try something else
